abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Energy Access
            Project for Ethiopia are to: (i) establish a sustainable
            program for expansion of access to electricity and for
            improvement of the quality and adequacy of the electricity
            supply in the Borrowers territory; (ii) reduce environmental
            degradation, and improve the supply and efficient use of
            energy; (iii) reduce the barrier to the wide spread use of
            renewable energy technologies; and (iv) provide technical
            support to the Borrower for the institutional and capacity
            building of key sector agencies, and for regulatory, fiscal
            and institutional reforms in the mining sector to attract
            private investment. The original credit components remain
            unchanged. However, the planned activities to be financed
            with proceeds of the additional credit related to the
            component one urban distribution and load dispatch will be
            cancelled entirely under the additional credit. A
            significant amount of the activities under component two
            rural electrification - grid based expansion will also be
            cancelled. Funds will be reallocated to increase the
            financing of component two (b) and five to carry out the
            activities described in paragraphs 12 and 16 respectively.
